Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie M
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I spent a weekend here in March 2012 and we were very pleased with the accomodations. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly, the rate was very reasonable, and the hotel is located in a safe area (important for two women traveling on their own) and is only a block or two from the Place d'Italie Metro station. It's true that the room was small but since we didn't go to Paris to hang around the hotel, it was fine for us. We didn't have the hotel breakfast - it seemed expensive to me - but there are plenty of cafes and boulangeries nearby that are even open on Sunday mornings. If I'm ever lucky enough to travel to Paris again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: AnneM0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in November 2011. As written by others the rooms are indeed very small, though clean and comfortable. The hotel is located in a ' village like' area of Paris a bit off the beaten track. It faces an old factory and further down the road you find a primary school. Pleasant staff, sufficient breakfast, easy access via metro and a nice shopping mall can be reached within a few minutes by foot. It is a nice location, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Petit but charming”
Reviews.Author: cpawley
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel regularly due to the discount offered by our Lab. The hotel is very convenient for those who are working within Ile-de-Paris and beyond with good metro and subsequent RER connections. The hotel is very efficient, the staff are welcoming and speak a multitude of languages. My room was small - but not uncomfortable given that we were only there for 8hrs/day to sleep. The rooms do get bigger the further up you go. Breakfast is typically French - useful to fill up on for tourists or workers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: wvtravelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Jan 2010 while visiting Paris, very clean and friendly helpful staff, car parking is just around the corner and the metro train station is an easy walk and can be taken down to all the main sights from this location without switching trains and its quick ride. Definatly a place to think about if your going to see the city on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small and efficient!”
Reviews.Author: Mahoganybird
Reviews.Content: Quiet street and atmosphere, newly remodeled hotel, very clean rooms, adequate breakfast, staff friendly and helpful. Five minute walk from the metro. Highly recommended. Beware though small rooms! Good for a short low budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sabine1981_7
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, simple but good breakfast, rooms are tiny but very comfortable! I would recommend to stay here if you are in a small budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nathalievb
Reviews.Content: -Good location, near shops and the metro. - Very small rooms, and the bathroom was too small. I have to brush my teeth while i was sitting on the toilet. -Room was modern and clean. - Hotelstaff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BrionPerth
Reviews.Content: For under 100 Euro this hotel was a good find. Located on a quiet tree lined street away from traffic noise Jacks Hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the metro underground. There are plenty of restaurants near by. The room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was small but modern and well appointed. A pleasant breakfast available which was typically french. We chose a cafe down the road where we had the most memorable omelets.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with jack's”
Reviews.Author: stephrouthier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jack's over New year's eve this year. It was very clean and comfy. The room was small, but that was ok, there was enough room for us, and we weren't in Paris to hang out in our room anyways! It was very clean, same with the bathroom (which was small again, but totally fine, clean and everything worked). It is right by the place d'italie metro station, and there were a few good cafes/restaurants in the area. It was really easy to get to/from the airport (CDG) and the area felt safe (we arrived by metro at about 11pm with our bags and felt safe walking to the hotel). It took about 10 minutes max on the metro to get to touristy places. The breakfast was good and was about 8 euro each. The hotel was quiet and friendly, and I would defintely stay here again. If you don't mind not being within walking distance to the tourist attractions and are happy to take the short metro rides (very easy to figure out) I would reccommend Jacks as a good cheap place to stay anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Jack's is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimMid_West
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel two times. It is a budget hotel and is all one needs for a trip to Paris. The rooms are small but clean. The staff couldn't be more helpful. They arranged for a taxi for us and guided us through other transportation issues. Their continental breakfast is delicious! I plan on staying at Jack's again!

HotelInfo.Name: Jack's Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 19, avenue Stephen Pichon | 13th Arr., 75013 Paris, France
